title: Type inference with var
summary: Use var for local variable type inference ‚Äî less noise, same safety.
explanation: Since Java 10, the compiler infers local variable types from the right-hand side. This reduces visual noise without sacrificing type safety. Use var when the type is obvious from context.

whyModernWins.title: Less boilerplate
whyModernWins.desc: No need to repeat complex generic types on both sides of the assignment.

whyModernWins.title: Better readability
whyModernWins.desc: Focus on variable names and values, not type declarations.

whyModernWins.title: Still type-safe
whyModernWins.desc: The compiler infers and enforces the exact type at compile time.
